title: About Proteome Array Alliance
description1: The "High-Throughput Protein Microarray Technology and Biomedical Industry Service Alliance" is dedicated to promoting the application of high-throughput protein microarray technology in the biomedical field. It establishes a platform for industry-academia collaboration to accelerate advances in precision medicine, antibody screening, disease diagnosis, and biomarker development.
description2: By combining academic research with industrial technological applications, we provide cutting-edge technologies and services to foster biotechnology industry growth and enhance the value of research and clinical applications.

leadership.title: Leadership
leadership.bio: A pioneer in proteome microarray technology with a focus on high-throughput biosensing, host-microbe interactions, and food pathogen detection.
leadership.quote: Investors bet on the scientist behind the tech.

ncuRoles: Professor, Dept. of Biomedical Science & Engineering (2016)
Director, Graduate Institute of Systems Biology & Bioinformatics (2015–2017)
timeline.postdoc: Postdoctoral Fellow, High Throughput Biology Center.

bioinformatics.title: Bioinformatics & Data
bioinformatics.subtitle: Handling the Data Load
bioinformatics.description: High-throughput proteomics generates massive datasets. Our dedicated bioinformatics team ensures that every pixel from our scanners is accurately converted into biological insight. We utilize custom pipelines for normalization, background subtraction, and statistical analysis.
points: Cloud-scalable storage for terabytes of array data

facilities.title: Our Facilities
facilities.description: We operate a fully equipped proteomic profiling facility, not just a laptop. Our lab houses industrial-grade contact printers, high-resolution fluorescence scanners, and automated liquid handling robots to ensure reproducibility at scale.
